Description: Biconical mace-head, pointed at each end, made of banded limestone, centrally bored.
Curator's comments: Published: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), 21, 33; pl. xx.3, viii.39; discussed in K.M. Cialowicz, Les têtes de massues des périodes prédynastique et archaïque de la vallée du Nil. (Warszawa/Krakow. 1987), pp.26-27 When found before the face of the man in the grave, it had remnants of its wooden handle preserved ( see Ayrton and Loat 1911,pl. viii.39). Grave H23 at Mahasna is significant for the number and variety of mace-heads it contained (see also EA 49003-4).
